text: With over 7.6 million encounters at the southern border      since President Biden took office, the wall is only the beginning of where he should start to secure the border.

The Administration’s hypocrisy over the last 2.5 years on the border wall makes the latest announcement      too little, too late. President Biden has ignored and minimized the humanitarian crisis in favor of open-border policies.

Domestic energy production is vital to our nation’s prosperity and security.  I join @SenatorRisch and @SenLummis on National Energy Appreciation Day in honoring the people who power America for their contributions that improve our quality of life. crapo.senate.gov/media/newsr…

IRS guardrails failed to prevent this brazen breach of taxpayer rights. Resolving these and other ongoing security issues at the IRS, as well as identifying and making whole the individuals impacted by this breach, must be the IRS’s highest priority. wsj.com/us-news/law/u-s-char…

Tomorrow at 12:20/11:20 PM MT/PT, @fema plans to test the nationwide emergency alert system with test alerts on cell phones, wireless devices, radios and TVs. This is a standard test and no action is needed. More information can be found in the link below. newsnationnow.com/weather/fe…

To ensure a competitive and vibrant pharmacy marketplace for Idahoans, I’m pushing widely supported legislation that takes aim at certain industry practices that threaten the critical community pharmacy model. magicvalley.com/opinion/colu…

My amendment to the SAFER Banking Act is part of my long-standing effort to prevent federal regulators from choking off capital to disfavored industries. It would have clarified that reputational risk constitutes neither an unsafe nor unsound practice, nor a violation of law.

Government shutdowns hurt taxpayers. The CR will keep the government's lights on while ensuring our troops & border agents receive the pay they have earned. @SenatorRisch & I will continue advocating for a long-term solution that saves taxpayer $$ & serves the needs of Idahoans.

Dianne Feinstein dedicated her life to public service and never wavered in that commitment.  I will always remember her support for the Idaho National Lab.  I offer my condolences to her family, friends, staff and loved ones and pray they find peace in the difficult days ahead.

The @dodpaa shared an update with my office that it made progress on locating and identifying the possible wreckage site of Filer, Idaho, native Lt. Bud Hayes.  The Agency’s discovery is a positive step forward in the hope of bringing him home.

.@ronwyden and I introduced legislation that will modernize federal prescription drug benefits to drive down drugs costs for millions of Americans and ensure seniors can access the pharmacy of their choice. finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…

The Finance Committee heard from important nominees today, including for IRS Chief Counsel. I stressed the importance of transparent, timely communication with Congress to ensure taxpayers are adequately served and the rule of law is upheld.

Invasive quagga mussels were recently found in the Snake River. To ensure the protection of Idaho's waterways, the Idaho State Department of Agriculture is urging all Idahoans to stay off the water between Niagara Springs and Twin Falls. Learn more: agri.idaho.gov/main/plants/s…
Happy #NationalPotatoMonth! Spuddy Buddy is here in the U.S. Capitol to represent the diligent Idaho potato farmers that keep Americans fed nationwide and millions of others globally.
When a servicemember dies for our freedom, it is not just their sacrifice, but their family's as well. Today, I offer my love, sorrow and reverence to all Gold Star Mothers and their families.

The U.S. Senate unanimously agreed to designate September 17-23, 2023, as #NationalForensicScienceWeek. This resolution recognizes the importance of forensic science in delivering truth in the justice system and honors the field's contributions to society.

The abuse of public health emergencies to strip Americans of Second Amendment rights is excessive government control.  @SenatorRisch and I introduced legislation to prevent the use of emergencies to impose gun control. crapo.senate.gov/media/newsr…

In 2021, the IRS destroyed 30 million unprocessed tax returns, leading to unwarranted and onerous examination of many hardworking taxpayers and denial of tax benefits they are entitled to. This is unacceptable. We need answers. finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…

According to the @dodpaa, 81,000 Americans remain missing from past conflicts.  Read more about #MIAMonday and my other longtime efforts to highlight their service and the continuing work to bring them home: crapo.senate.gov/news/in-the…

For 236 years, the U.S. Constitution's enduring principles of individual rights, limited governance and a representative government have served as the foundation of our nation.  This #ConstitutionWeek, I am proud to serve a country that puts life, liberty and freedom first.

By addressing the overly-burdensome taxes on the Veterinary Medicine Loan Repayment Program, our bill will help ensure access to needed veterinarian care for Idaho’s farmers and ranchers, and meet growing demand for veterinarians nationwide.
crapo.senate.gov/media/newsr…

This #AirForceBirthday, I celebrate the brave men and women stationed at Mountain Home Air Force Base and express gratitude for their service to this country.  Their bravery and dedication to our nation are unmatched.

Instead of devoting time and resources to new initiatives that could put even more confidential taxpayer information at risk, the IRS should focus on fixing its existing security deficiencies and improving customer service for taxpayers
A new report says there are dozens of new and longstanding security weaknesses surrounding the protection of taxpayer information at the IRS. finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…

In recognition of National POW/MIA Recognition Day, I honor the American servicemembers who remain missing from past conflicts. My prayers are with their families and their service in protecting our nation and its people is not forgotten. #POWMIARecognitionDay

U.S. Highway 20 (US-20) stretches across our country from Oregon to Massachusetts. Read more on how designating US-20 as the "National Medal of Honor Highway" ensures all 3,516 Medal of Honor recipients and future recipients are recognized coast to coast: idahopress.com/emmett/opinio…

Throughout #SuicidePreventionAwarenessMonth, it is important to raise awareness, improve education and decrease the stigmatization regarding suicide.  Let's keep the conversation going to connect with people and spread resources to prevent suicide in all our communities.

Without question, Taiwan is a critical ally for Idaho and U.S. businesses. The Finance Committee’s important work will end double taxation on individuals and businesses, strengthening our economic ties.

The Biden Administration continues to attack the way Idahoans live with counterproductive measures that decrease the safety and knowledge these programs provide.  The ARROW Act supports the education of young sportsmen and women.

Staggering new estimates put pandemic unemployment insurance fraud between $100 to $135 billion—double the original estimated amount. Congress should pass our legislation to recoup the stolen funds and prevent similar theft from happening in the future.  finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…

Ensuring Idaho’s senior citizens have access to federal resources is a priority.  I am committed to bringing the information to them and sharing details about federal programs with which my office may be able to assist.

Jardine received three Oak Leaf Clusters as well as an Award of Distinguished Flying Cross and an Award of Commendation Ribbon during his service. He received a Purple Heart posthumously. Read more about First Lieutenant Jardine on my website. crapo.senate.gov/military-mo…

This #MIAMonday, I honor First Lieutenant Ray Frank Jardine of Idaho Falls. Jardine served in the U.S. Army Air Corps and, later, the U.S. Air Force in WWII and the Korean War. He was a B-29 Superfortress Bomber crewman with the 93rd Bombardment Squadron, 19th Bombardment Group.

During the somber remembrance of the September 11 attacks 22 years ago, we must remain strong and united for those we lost that day, including Idahoans Ronald Vauk of Nampa and Brady Howell of Sugar City.
Wishing you all a safe and happy Labor Day!

Whether it's a @ClifBar from Twin Falls, Idaho, or another trail mix, be sure to take a snack with you if you hike one of Idaho's hundreds of hiking trails this National Trail Mix Day.  Here’s just a few of the beautiful views you may see.

The Biden Administration continues to exercise unnecessary federal overreach with regard to unlawfully expanding the intentions of the Clean Water Act. The fight to restore rights to states and personal property owners is one I won’t give up.

The sweeping price-setting program included in the Inflation Reduction Act ignores key economic realities and risks reversing decades of progress on bringing lifesaving treatments and medical breakthroughs to American patients. Here are the facts: finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…
In honor of International Dog Day, please meet my dog, Ruby, and many of the other furry companions of my staff members.

Happy birthday to the @NatlParkService!

Idahoans are lucky to have easy access to several amazing National Parks. For over 100 years, the National Park Service has helped to protect and preserve them. Thank you, National Park Service, for all you do for America’s National Parks.

By addressing the overly-burdensome taxes on the Veterinary Medicine Loan Repayment Program, our bill will help ensure access to needed veterinarian care for Idaho’s farmers and ranchers, and meet growing demand for veterinarians nationwide.
crapo.senate.gov/media/newsr…

This #AirForceBirthday, I celebrate the brave men and women stationed at Mountain Home Air Force Base and express gratitude for their service to this country.  Their bravery and dedication to our nation are unmatched.

In honor of International Dog Day, please meet my dog, Ruby, and many of the other furry companions of my staff members.

Happy birthday to the @NatlParkService!

Idahoans are lucky to have easy access to several amazing National Parks. For over 100 years, the National Park Service has helped to protect and preserve them. Thank you, National Park Service, for all you do for America’s National Parks.
Great visit with Chief Allan of the @CdATribe to catch up on issues important to the tribe. I wished him well in his continued recovery from an accident earlier this summer.

#ICYMI: We cannot wait around for an economic earthquake. We need dedication at all levels of the federal government to truly buckle down and get our fiscal house in order. magicvalley.com/opinion/colu…

I visited the Porthill Port of Entry, which continues operating on limited hours. I am a co-sponsor of @SenatorRisch’s bill to require CBP to return all northern ports of entry to—at a minimum—pre-pandemic hours. This is necessary for commerce & maintaining national security.

The NRC’s final rule on adv. reactor emergency planning is critical to furthering efforts to license the next generation of advanced nuclear reactors in a safe, timely & transparent manner. These efforts will continue to further @INL & the nation’s leadership in nuclear energy.

Happy National Back to School Month!  Thank you to our educators who make our children's futures possible.  I wish all of Idaho's teachers, families and students a strong and joyful start to the school year.

While serving in Afghanistan, Mostoller received a Navy Achievement Medal with a V for Valor for his bravery acting in immediate danger to save the lives of other fellow Marines. Thank you for your service, Cpl Mostoller! Read more about his efforts here ⬇️crapo.senate.gov/military-mo…
This #MilitaryMonday, I honor Corporal William Mostoller of Hagerman. Mostoller served in the @USMC as a light armored vehicle mechanic.

Meet Sarah Clevenger and Taylor Jepson, two more interns in my Boise and D.C. offices this summer!  Please check out their profiles on my internship spotlight page to learn more about them and how to apply for internships in my state or D.C. offices. crapo.senate.gov/intern-spot…

This legislation will mitigate misaligned incentives that drive prices up, prevent spread pricing in Medicare, improve pharmacy access, and increase oversight in the drug supply chain. 
kmvt.com/2023/08/09/senator-…

Happy birthday, @smithsonian!  Thank you for your efforts to conserve and showcase Idaho's history.  You can explore Idaho photographs, portraits and more from the Gem State on the Smithsonian’s website⬇️  si.edu/spotlight/idaho

The cost of prescription drugs is a very serious pressure on every family in the United States. The proposals @SenFinance is working on will enhance PBM accountability & increase oversight of the prescription drug supply chain to lower costs for Americans.
magicvalley.com/news/crapo-i…
It was an honor to meet with veteran leaders from Cassia and Minidoka counties.  We must continue to honor those who served our country by providing them with support and resources.

Thank you to Gini & Lisa of @alzassociation for their hard work & leadership in advocating for Alzheimer’s research. @RepRussFulcher & I presented them a Congressional Record Statement submitted along w/ @SenatorRisch & @CongMikeSimpson to show our gratitude for their efforts.
Had a great visit with Bill Colley on Magic Valley This Morning on @1310KLIX.  Always a pleasure to hear directly from Idahoans about the issues that concern them the most.

Today, on Purple Heart Day, we honor the selflessness and courage of America's Purple Heart recipients.  Many brave Idaho men and women were wounded or killed to protect the freedom all Americans cherish. We can never thank those who gave the ultimate sacrifice enough.

Meet Sarah Young and Gabriel Jose Rodriguez-Figueroa, two interns in my Boise office this summer!  Please check out their profiles on my internship spotlight page to learn more about them and how to apply for internships in my state or D.C. offices. crapo.senate.gov/intern-spot…
Opinion: A Friend To Idaho, Taiwan Is Important Strategically and Economically magicvalley.com/opinion/colu…

Happy 233rd birthday to the @USCG!  The USCGC Bluebell and the rest of the Coast Guard's fleet are critical to our national defense.  I am thankful for their service in keeping our nation's water safe and secure.

Efficient and clean-energy technologies are a growing need. @INL and Idaho at-large are at the cutting edge of meeting the challenge of providing mobile energy sources.  Read more on how continued investment in nuclear energy backs this important work:  postregister.com/opinion/gue…

Meet Landen Blades and Jacob Sauer, two more interns in my Washington, D.C., office this summer!  Please check out their profiles on my internship spotlight page to learn more about them and how to apply for internships in my state or D.C. offices. crapo.senate.gov/intern-spot…
Happy #NationalInternDay to my talented and hardworking interns in D.C. and Boise!  Learn how to apply for internships on my website: crapo.senate.gov/services/fo…

Taiwan’s unique status, which precludes a traditional income tax treaty to alleviate double taxation, requires a unique solution. I look forward to marking up legislation this fall to provide immediate relief for U.S. and Taiwanese workers and businesses.
finance.senate.gov/chairmans…

Idaho's wildlife is already managed at the local level through best practices backed by science and common sense.  The grizzly's ESA listing rejects the reality of the recovered population within the grizzly’s historic range and must needs be rectified for the future.

The Finance Committee passed important, bipartisan legislation to bring more transparency, accountability and competition to pharmacy benefit manager practices in the drug supply chain, ultimately driving down prescription drug costs for Americans.

Today marks 70 years since the signing of the Korean Armistice Agreement at 10 AM on July 27, 1953, in Panmunjom.  May we remember all who served and the sacrifices they made while upholding liberty and democracy in this conflict.

Active forest management is a worthwhile and essential means of preventing catastrophic wildfires. @forestservice should forge a partnership with the private sector to reduce fire risk and invigorate rural communities that rely on the timber industry.

Freight and shipping companies’ latest policies discriminating against businesses and law-abiding citizens blatantly infringe on the lawful commerce of firearms and impede American citizens' Second Amendment right to keep and bear arms. crapo.senate.gov/media/newsr…

Meet Austin Smith and Idelia Robinson-Confer, two interns in my Washington, D.C., office this summer!  Please check out their profiles on my internship spotlight page to learn more about them and how to apply for internships in my state or D.C. offices. crapo.senate.gov/intern-spot…

Opinion: Tackling Tax Complexity for Idaho's Small Businesses
magicvalley.com/opinion/colu…

It is integral that the United States continue to work together with our ally, Israel.  I co-sponsored @SenTomCotton's resolution reaffirming American support for Israel, and I remain a strong advocate for promoting greater peace in a volatile region.

In order to provide our veterans, servicemembers and their families with support and access to essential resources, @SenatorBennet, @SenatorRisch, @SenatorHick and I introduced the Helping Unleash Benefits and Services (HUBS) for Veterans Act. crapo.senate.gov/media/newsr…

The Department of Labor received significant funding under the American Rescue Plan Act to fight unemployment insurance fraud, but has provided few details on how it has been used or its effectiveness. Taxpayers deserve answers to these basic questions:
finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…

Deepening our ties with Taiwan and its vibrant democracy is important for strengthening our long-term partnership.  We passed important legislation to do just that, while reasserting Congress’s constitutional authority over trade agreements. finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…

I am proud to introduce the Fighter Force Preservation and Recapitalization Act to prevent the closure of Air National Guard (ANG) fighter squadrons at a time when pilot and maintenance manning are at critically low levels. crapo.senate.gov/media/newsr…

Ensuring the Air National Guard fighter squadrons remain strong and ready to protect America is a top priority. To safeguard the ability of fighter squadrons to grow and modernize, I introduced the Fighter Force Preservation and Recapitalization Act.

Finance Committee Republicans are calling for an investigation into multiple reports of alleged IRS agent misconduct. Americans deserve a fair and just tax system, not one that employs intimidation tactics and deception against them. finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…

🚨 OECD global tax guidance released today acknowledges what Republicans have warned for over two years: the Administration’s global tax surrender is unworkable and unlawful. 🚨 finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…
Visitors are now able to tour EBR-1 for free: inl.gov/experimental-breeder…

On this day in 1955, BORAX III, an experimental nuclear reactor, allowed the City of Arco, Idaho, to become the first city lit solely by nuclear power. EBR-1, the first reactor to create usable electricity, paved the way for BORAX & is now a National Historic Landmark.

Ensuring everyone knows where to turn for help is one of my top priorities.  In its first year of operation, the #988Lifeline provided 24/7 support to nearly 5 million people struggling with their mental health or thinking about suicide. I am proud to support 988.

The IRS should focus on fixing its existing problems and providing Idahoans with essential services, not squandering resources to create a “free-file” system that will inevitably become the IRS’s next boondoggle. postregister.com/opinion/gue…

We owe it to America's servicemembers and their families to reduce the bureaucratic red tape and strengthen the effort to identify and recover those who are not yet home.  The Bring Our Heroes Home Act does just that.

I am once again working with @SenatorShaheen to re-introduce the Bring Our Heroes Home Act, which would eliminate obstacles preventing families from accessing the records needed for recovering America’s prisoners of war and missing in action. crapo.senate.gov/media/newsr…
Happy #NationalFrenchFryDay! Thank you to @IdahoPotato and all the hard-working Idaho potato farmers that feed Americans nationwide.

With @SenatorLujan, I recently filed bipartisan legislation to amend the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act (RECA) to finally include Idaho counties in the program.  Idohans exposed to radiation and fallout during the Cold War deserve recompense. idahopress.com/emmett/news/d…

The bipartisan, bicameral discussion draft released today will provide much needed certainty for U.S. businesses investing in Taiwan, and vice-versa, that will unlock investment, create more jobs, and lead to greater shared prosperity. finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…
Small businesses have a strong advocate in @kevinolearytv, also known as Mr. Wonderful from Shark Tank. Our meeting covered a number of issues affecting the backbone businesses of our economy.
Hey, @kristin__wilson and @burgessev, your favorite Crapo staffer stopped by for a visit!
I offer my sincerest condolences to his wife, Carmelita, and the many other Idahoans who will surely miss his vision and advocacy.
His service in the U.S. Air Force, as a leader of the VFW, and as a member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints left an indelible mark on everything and every life he encountered.
I am deeply saddened to learn of the passing of my friend, and a tireless veterans’ advocate, Bob Jones. Bob dedicated his life to God, country and community.

Interested in an internship in my Washington, D.C., or Idaho offices? Visit my website for more information on Fall 2023 and Spring 2024 college student internship opportunities. crapo.senate.gov/media/newsr…

This #MIAMonday, I honor Commander Roderick L. Mayer. Commander Mayer flew over 80 missions in the @USNavy during the Vietnam War until he was shot down and went #MIA. Read more here: crapo.senate.gov/military-mo…

Last year, @SenatorLujan and I passed legislation to extend the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act for two years. We can do more to help the Americans who have suffered the health consequences of exposure to fallout from nuclear weapons testing.
kdvr.com/news/nationalworld-…

The Russian Government has now unlawfully held American journalist Evan Gershkovich for 100 days. Every day he spends in Russia is a day too long. Evan—and every other wrongfully detained American—must be released NOW. #IStandWithEvan
Today we celebrate the creation of our extraordinary country and the independence on which it was formed.  Wishing you a safe and happy Independence Day!
On July 3, 1890, President Benjamin Harrison signed a proclamation admitting Idaho into the Union as the 43rd state. Happy Statehood Day, Idaho!

The Fourth of July gives us an opportunity to celebrate the honor it is to be an American with shared unalienable rights. As joyful as this holiday is, however, we cannot forget its importance nor take our freedoms for granted. 
 
idahocountyfreepress.com/opi…

The last thing the IRS should be doing right now is diverting resources away from fixing its existing problems to create a “free-file” system that will inevitably become the IRS’s next boondoggle. foxnews.com/opinion/last-thi…

I continue to advocate for Idaho farmers and ranchers to weather difficult times and make continued advancements. May Idaho dairy farmers’ work be blessed with continued growth and success.
 
magicvalley.com/opinion/colu…
Congratulations, Jake!

Reducing slowdowns by eliminating unfair labor practices imposed by unions is best for maritime workers and their livelihoods while allowing companies to compete in a modern marketplace. crapo.senate.gov/media/newsr…

Ahead of Indian Prime Minister Modi’s state visit, @RonWyden and I are urging the Administration to prioritize the elimination of India’s numerous barriers to U.S. trade and investment that harm U.S. producers, including Idaho's farmers and manufacturers. finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…

Idaho's Boy Scout Troop 77 is evidence of the benefits of exemplary first aid & leadership training. Their swift efforts responding to a real-life emergency scenario are nothing short of remarkable, and I applaud them for their grit in action. ktvb.com/article/news/local/…

Idaho proudly continues to support the @IDNationalGuard Youth ChalleNGe Program. I was proud to co-sponsor a resolution in the Senate celebrating the 30th anniversary of the program this year. 
ktvb.com/article/news/local/…

Slavery tainted America’s promise of liberty and justice for all.  #Juneteenth celebrates an end to this abhorrent period, recognizes the contributions of Black American culture and marks a renewed commitment to ensuring opportunity for all Americans.

Join me in celebrating and congratulating Idaho’s participants in the @SOWG_Berlin2023, which begins tomorrow. Good luck, Jake Kerr and Devin Riley! You’re representing Idaho well on team @SpecialOlyUSA! #Cheer4USA kivitv.com/news/coeur-dalene…

This #FlagWeek, I am reminded of the hope the American flag inspires around the world. It is not the symbol of a nation without flaws, but rather a beacon of hope, unity, strength and the ideals we collectively hold as Americans.

June is National Dairy Month. I am proud to co-sponsor the Whole Milk for Healthy Kids Act of 2023 to allow schools to serve whole milk as part of the National School Lunch Program.  
crapo.senate.gov/media/newsr…

Policies that incentivize work, job training and self-sufficiency are the best way to reduce poverty and support families. Successes from the past have proven that we can exercise common sense, be compassionate and be fiscally responsible all at the same time.

Founded on this day 248 years ago, the @USArmy continues to make a difference in the lives of every American through its dedication to preserving our freedoms here at home and abroad. America’s soldiers are the embodiment of strength, honor and courage. Happy birthday, Army!

This Alzheimer’s and Brain Awareness Month, I continue to fight to stop harmful policies delaying access to treatment for Alzheimer’s patients. The Administration must reverse course and provide access to life-saving treatments as quickly as possible.

Engaging with patients, frontline providers and health care stakeholders will enable us to develop the policy solutions needed to address current shortages and prevent these patterns from jeopardizing access to care for Americans from all walks of life. finance.senate.gov/ranking-m…

The recent surge in shortages of critical medications has delayed crucial care and exacerbated access gaps for patients and families across Idaho, including those living with cancer and a range of other life-threatening conditions.

After his retirement, SFC Heisey helped many Idaho veterans navigate the VA benefits process as a Veterans Service Officer for 16 years. He continues to serve his community as a worship leader in Hayden. Thank you for your service! Read more⬇️ crapo.senate.gov/military-mo…

This #MilitaryMonday, I honor Sergeant First Class (Retired) Darryl L. Heisey, who served a long, dedicated career in the U.S. Army. His service allowed him to serve out his faith in various capacities in Chaplain services.

Protecting natural resources & the environment is a collaborative effort at every level. This bill supports watershed restoration while encouraging collaboration as a benefit to small, rural & disadvantaged communities & tribes w/out exerting federal control over private lands.
Congratulations to Travis Myklebust for his three-decade career dedicated to the city and people of Lewiston. I wish you the best in your retirement!

The Ninth Circuit’s 2015 Cottonwood decision was disastrous for proactive forest management practices. Last month, @EnergyGOP passed legislation I support to reverse this decision. It is well past time for a vote on the Senate floor.
🔥 No matter how a wildfire starts, it is evident they are burning longer and hotter due to poor management of our federal forests. Let’s fix it NOW.

🔥In 2022, wildfires burned over 436,000 acres in Idaho alone.  The vast majority of these fires burned on lands managed by the federal government. 52% of Idaho’s burned acreage that year were not caused by climate; instead, they were the result of wildfires started by humans.
✅Reauthorize and expand the Collaborative Forest Landscape Restoration Program, which has a proven track record of improving forest health, reducing wildfire risk and supporting rural communities.
✅Engage in real conversations about prescribed fires and targeted grazing.
✅ Expedite the environmental review process for projects that remove invasive species, like cheatgrass and pinyon-juniper, from federal lands and forests.

✅ Reverse the disastrous Cottonwood decision handed down by the Ninth Circuit. Fixing this loophole that allows third parties to halt forestry activity will allow agencies to partake in important wildfire restoration activities.

🧵As wildfire smoke continues to blow into the Nation’s Capital from Canada, Congress can take action to prevent the spread of wildfires here at home. We MUST address our forest health and current mismanagement practices. Here’s how⬇️
